result.execSummary:
The defendant Stephanie G. Gregg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Negligent Operation of Motor Vehicle, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Credit to be determined if revoked.
Counts 1 & 2 are concurrent.
After successful completion of probation, DE may write letter to court requesting expungment and detail benefits to DE and society.  Court may grant if satisfied.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent. Pay supervision fees. Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence. Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription. Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by agent - Including mental health treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program  OR  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation. 
* Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges. 
* If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered. 
* Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay the surcharge, notice given to def. in court.                                                                                   
 May not have contact with parents Brian G and Lisa G, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent. May not possess any weapons, including firearms.   Take all medications as prescribed.  DOC to assign a mental health specialist as supervising agent.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Completion of Representation
Submitted by Atty Michelle Gardner
DNA
Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge

2:36 PM Defendant Stephanie G. Gregg in court, in custody.  Attorney Michelle M. Gardner in court for Stephanie G. Gregg.  Attorney Jessica L. Krejcarek in court for State of Wisconsin. Clerk HM. State is compliant with victim rights notification.  Amended Information filed.  DE enters guilty plea to cts 1 and 2.   Court finds DE guilty of cts 1 and 2.  Ct 1 - court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions; Ct 2 - court withholds sentence and places DE on probation for 2 years with conditions concurrent to ct 1; credit to be determined if revoked;  DE to submit DNA sample and pay surcharge - notice given to DE in court. DE requests expungement. No objection by state.  After successful completion of probation; DE write letter to court requesting same and detail benefits to DE and society. Court may grant if satisfied.  Appeal rights given.
Due to ongoing trial, 8/31 FPT rescheduled.  Atty Knapp requests PLEAS - 9/22 2:30pm.
Court reviewed letter from Behavioral Health Jail Diversion Program Coordinator filed on 8/4/22.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Knapp.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE not eligible for diversion program.  Attys will discuss other options.  Adjmt granted.  FPT 8/31 10am. Bond continued.
from Behavioral Health Jail Diversion Program Coordinator, Rebecca P. regarding DE's eligibility for the program.

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Knapp.    Clerk HMcBride.   Stip to findings in report. DE agrees she is competent. Court finds DE is competent.   FPT 8/5 10am. Bond continued.
and  Cover sheet for confidential records.
Order for Comp Exam Form CR 205 sent to DHS, WCS notified and copy to KCJ
Form CR 205
Proposed Order for Comp Exam

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared IC by zoom and w/ Attorney Watson for Atty Knapp.    Clerk HMcBride.  State raises competency issues and requests eval. No objection. Court finds probable cause and orders a comp eval be prepared.  RH 6/6 2:30pm.  Bond continued.
For Competency Exam

Attorney Jessica Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared by zoom w/ Attorney Knapp.   Clerk HMcBride.  DE's motion for bond reduction.  State objects.   Court hears argument.   Court denies request without a mental health plan in place.   PTC 6/6 2:30pm remains calendared.  Bond continued.
Deft's Motion For Bond Reduction

Defendant Stephanie G. Gregg appeared with Attorney Michelle M. Knapp.  Defendant in custody. Attorney Alexandra Kathleen Smathers appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness TLPD Det Austin Sobczak; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Knapp. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Submitted by Atty Michelle Knapp
